get.summary: Enumerate returns a list of objects

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: Organization id

parameters.name: enumerateOptions.labels
parameters.description:
label selectors for the object for filtering

This is a request variable of the map type. The query format is "map_name[key]=value", e.g. If the map name is Age, the key type is string, and the value type is integer, the query parameter is expressed as Age["bob"]=18

parameters.name: enumerateOptions.maxObjects
parameters.description: max objects to fetch

parameters.name: enumerateOptions.nameFilter
parameters.description:
Filter to use for name of objects. Any object that contains the filter
will be returned

parameters.name: enumerateOptions.clusterNameFilter
parameters.description:
Filter to use for cluster name of objects. Any object that contains the
filter will be returned

parameters.name: enumerateOptions.includeDetailedResources
parameters.description:
Ths option will be set to true by the caller, when they want to have
complete backup object. That means the backupObject's
resource list will be set to complete list of resources.
If this option is set to false, resource list will be
set to nil and rest of the backupObject details will be returned in the
response.

parameters.name: enumerateOptions.clusterUidFilter
parameters.description:
Filter to use with cluster uid on objects. Any object that contains the
filter will be returned
Currently backup enumerate request should pass this along with cluster
name.

parameters.name: enumerateOptions.owners
parameters.description:
Filter to use owner uids on objects. Any object that contains the
filter will be returned

parameters.name: enumerateOptions.backupObjectType
parameters.description: filter to use backupObjectType on object

parameters.name: enumerateOptions.status
enumerateOptions.sortOption.sortBy.type
parameters.description: Name of the field by which sort to be performed

parameters.name: enumerateOptions.sortOption.sortOrder.type
parameters.description: Order of sorting

post.summary: Enumerate returns a list of backup schedule

get.summary: Inspect returns detail information about a specified backup schedule

parameters.name: deleteBackups
parameters.description: delete_backups is deprecated, not to be used.

parameters.name: backupObjectType.type
parameters.description:
- NS: Represents backup schedules scoped to Kubernetes namespaces (non-VM workloads).
Typically used for application-level backups.
 - VM: Represents backup schedules scoped to VirtualMachine workloads.
Used for VM-based backup scenarios.
 - All: Represents both NS and VM backup schedule types. Used when an operation should apply to all types.

parameters.name: includeFilter
parameters.description:
Substring or regex pattern to match backup schedules and include (e.g. "*" for All, "pxb-" or any valid regex)
Cannot be used with include_objects.

parameters.name: excludeFilter
parameters.description:
Substring or regex pattern to match backup schedules and exclude (e.g. "*" for All, "pxb-" or any valid regex)
Cannot be used with exclude_objects.

groups.description:
Group access to objects which must match the group set in the
authorization token.
Can be set by the owner or the system administrator only.
Possible values are:
1. no groups: Means no groups are given access.
2. `["*"]`: All groups are allowed.
3. `["group1", "group2"]`: Only certain groups are allowed. In this
example only
_group1_ and _group2_ are allowed.

collaborators.description:
Collaborator access to objects gives access to other user.
Must be the username (unique id) set in the authorization token.
The owner or the administrator can set this value. Possible values
are:
1. no collaborators: Means no users are given access.
2. `["*"]`: All users are allowed.
3. `["username1", "username2"]`: Only certain usernames are allowed.
In this example only
_username1_ and _username2_ are allowed.

BackupShare.title:
BackupShare for storing user and group details for whom the backups
will be shared

BackupShareAccessType.title:
- View: view access means the backup is shared for view only
It can not be used for restore
 - Restorable: Restorable access means the backup is shared for view and it can be
restore as well
 - FullAccess: The FullAccess means the backup is shared for view/restore and other
admin operations like update and delete

BackupShareUpdateRequest.title: Request message for backup share update request

BackupShareUpdateResponse.title: Response message for backup share update request

cloudCredential.description:
Reference to cloud credential object used for backup
cloud_credential is deprecated, not to be used.

deleteBackups.title:
delete_backups indicates whether  backups created by cluster owner that belong to the cluster need to
be deleted or retained. This flag can be set by cluster owner with any role during cluster deletion

deleteRestores.description:
delete_restores will determine whether the restore
belong to given cluster needs to be deleted or not.

addUserBackupShare.title:
map[user]BackupShare details for shared user of the cluster
contains cluster level backup shared by non owner of the cluster

delUserBackupShare.title:
contains map[user]BackupShare details to be deleted for cluster level backups of
non owner of the cluster

deletedBy.title: deleted_by uid of the user who initiated cluster delete

deleteAllClusterBackups.title:
delete_all_cluster_backups indicates whether all the backups(created by cluster owner, super admins and all the shared users)
on the cluster need to be deleted or retained. This flag can be set only by SuperAdmin while deleting the cluster

timeZone.title: time_zone is the time zone of the cluster

ClusterInfoBackupShareStatusInfo.description: Message for maintaining status of the backup share.

ClusterInfoBackupShareStatusInfoStatus.description:
- InProgress: InProgress if backupshare is going on for backups belonging to
the cluster
 - Failed: Failed if backupshare fails for some backups belonging to the
cluster
 - Success: Success if backupshare is successful for all current backups
belonging to the cluster
 - PartialSuccess: Parital Success if backupshare is successful for only few
backups.

ClusterInfoStatusInfo.description: Message for maintaining status of the cluster.

ClusterInfoStatusInfoStatus.title:
- Pending: Pending If a cluster addition is in pending state
 - Failed: Failed If a cluster failed to be added
 - Success: Success If cluster was successfully added but not Online yet

cloudCredential.description: cloud_credential is deprecated, not to be used.

labels.title: label selectors for the object for filtering

nameFilter.title:
Filter to use for name of objects. Any object that contains the filter
will be returned

owner.title: owner of the object. This field is deprecated, not to be used

encryptionSsl.title: Encryption if any (optional) default value is false

authentication.title: Authentication if any (optional) default values is false

allowCustomCertificate.title: Allow custom certificate for SMTP server client creation

tlsConfig.title: TLS configuration for SMTP server client creation

labels.title: label selectors for the object for filtering

timeRange.title: Time range for which to return objects

nameFilter.title:
Filter to use for name of objects. Any object that contains the filter
will be returned

clusterNameFilter.title:
Filter to use for cluster name of objects. Any object that contains the
filter will be returned

includeDetailedResources.description:
Ths option will be set to true by the caller, when they want to have
complete backup object. That means the backupObject's
resource list will be set to complete list of resources.
If this option is set to false, resource list will be
set to nil and rest of the backupObject details will be returned in the
response.

clusterUidFilter.description:
Filter to use with cluster uid on objects. Any object that contains the
filter will be returned
Currently backup enumerate request should pass this along with cluster
name.

owners.title:
Filter to use owner uids on objects. Any object that contains the
filter will be returned

backupObjectType.title: filter to use backupObjectType on object

schedulePolicyRef.description: filter to use policy name and uid. Any object that contains the filter will be returned.

backupScheduleRef.description: filter to use backup schedule policy name and uid. Any object that contains the filter will be returned.

sortOption.title:
Sorting backup objects based on the field and order
If the field is not set, default value will be "CreationTimestamp"
If the order is not set, default value will be "descending"

status.title: Representing if license is active or expired

LicenseType.title: - BaasStd: In future we might have different baas licensing

reportTime.title: Time at which license consumption is recorded in epoch time format

clusterName.title:
Region for scanning cluster
cluster name to be added

nextToken.title: Used for sending token, needed for pagination

For ListClusters() AWS provides pagination and next_token
is pointer for next set of cluster fetch

name.title:
Name of the managed cluster
This is usually the user friendly name of the cluster

uid.title:
UID of the managed cluster
This is the UID returned by the managed cluster provider

cloudCredential.title: Cloud Credential name used for fetching this cluster's details

kubeconfig.title: Kubeconfig if the provider supports using kubeconfigs

k8sVersion.description:
This flag indicates if the discovered cluster is already added in the
 objectstore.
 This will help UI to help user understand which clusters are already
 added and need to
 be added.
k8sVersion.title: k8s version

ManagedClusterObjectStatus.title: Status hold if the cluster is already present in datastore or not

owner.description:
owner of the object. This field is deprecated, not to be used
TODO: Currently gRPC supports marking field as [deprecated=true]
As we need to access this field as part of migration to new Ownership
message will not use the same for now.

labels.title: label selectors for the object for filtering

MetricsInfoType.description:
Check with charts/px-central/templates/px-backup/pxcentral-prometheus.yaml before 
adding Type here, few metrics are ignored.

lastSyncTime.title: Time at which last stats data was synced in epoch time format

ObjectRefList.title: Helper message to hold multiple cluster references as oneof doesn't allow repeated labels

owner.description:
Username of owner
The storage system uses the username taken from the token
and is saved on this field. Only users with system administration
can edit this value.

groups.description:
Group access to objects which must match the group set in the
authorization token.
Can be set by the owner or the system administrator only.
Possible values are:
1. no groups: Means no groups are given access.
2. `["*"]`: All groups are allowed.
3. `["group1", "group2"]`: Only certain groups are allowed. In this
example only
_group1_ and _group2_ are allowed.

collaborators.description:
Collaborator access to objects gives access to other user.
Must be the username (unique id) set in the authorization token.
The owner or the administrator can set this value. Possible values
are:
1. no collaborators: Means no users are given access.
2. `["*"]`: All users are allowed.
3. `["username1", "username2"]`: Only certain usernames are allowed.
In this example only
_username1_ and _username2_ are allowed.

public.title:
Public access to objects may be assigned for access by the public
userd
TODO: Instead of PublicAccessControl, can we just set '*' in
collaborators with required permission?

Ownership.description:
Ownership information for objects(eg: backup object, schedule object).
Administrators are users who belong to the group `*`, meaning, every group.

OwnershipAccessType.description:
- Read: Read access only and cannot affect the resource.
 - Write: Write access and can affect the resource.
This type automatically provides Read access also.
 - Admin: Administrator access.
This type automatically provides Read and Write access also.

type.title: AccessType declares which level of public access is allowed

enabled.title: Enabled will be an in memory value always fetched from Recevier Info

type.title: Type of notification on user level

recipientId.title: Based on type recipient list is added

severity.title: Filter level of alert by severity

backup.description: backup is deprecated, not to be used.

namespaceMapping.title: mapping of the namespaces from the backup to which restore should be done

replacePolicy.title: replace policy to use if the resource already exists

includeOptionalResourceTypes.title: optional resource types to be restored (eg Jobs)

storageClassMapping.title: storage class mapping for generic backup <source, destination>

backupRef.title: backup object reference having name and id

rancherProjectMapping.title:
mapping of the rancher projects from the backup to which restore should
be done

rancherProjectNameMapping.title: mapping of source rancher project display names to target rancher project display names

backupObjectType.title: backup object type is all namespace or virtualMachine specific backup

RestoreCreateRequestBackupObjectTypeType.title:
- All: for All application backup
 - VirtualMachine: virtualMachine for VirtualMachine specific backup

backup.description: backup is deprecated, not to be used.

backupLocation.description:
Name of backup location to restore from.
backup_location is deprecated, not to be used.

storageClassMapping.title: storage class mapping for generic backup <source, destination>

rancherProjectMapping.title:
mapping of the rancher projects from the backup to which restore should
be done

rancherProjectNameMapping.title: mapping of source rancher project display names to target rancher project display names

largeResourceEnabled.title: flag signifies if the restored backup involves large number of resources or not

restoredResourceCount.title: counter to show number of already restored resources

restoreStatus.title: current activity while doing resource restore

backupObjectType.title: backup object type is all namespace or virtualMachine specific backup

RestoreInfoBackupObjectTypeType.title:
- All: for All application backup
 - VirtualMachine: virtualMachine for VirtualMachine specific backup

RestoreInfoStatusInfo.description: Message for maintaining status of the object.

RestoreObject.description: Message for Restore object which will be stored in Datastore.

apis.title: The API name in the service in lowercase

RoleConfig.title:
RoleConfig object for set of rules associated with each role object
services - PX-Backup services names
apis - allowed apis for px-backup services

RoleCreateRequest.title:
RoleCreateRequest defines roleobject create structure
Metadata with each role object
RoleConfig set of rules over api services for given role object

RulesInfo.title: Message for passing pre and post exec rules for backup

sseType.description:
Server side encryption type name
Currently supporting only SSE-S3 and SSE-KMS type alone.

azureEnvironment.title:
Azure environment type
Currently supporting only AZURE_GLOBAL and AZURE_CHINA

azureResourceGroupName.title: Azure resource group name. This is needed in the case of azure immutable bucket to get the retention period (optional)

S3ConfigAzureEnvironmentTypeType.title:
- AZURE_GLOBAL: Azure public environment
 - AZURE_CHINA: Azure china environment

S3ConfigSse.title:
- SSE_S3: Server-side encryption with AWS S3 managed keys
 - SSE_KMS: Server-side encryption with AWS Key Management Service

backupSchedule.description: list of backup schedule object that uses this schedule policy.

forObjectLock.description:
for_object_lock should be set, if this policy is planned to be used with
locked bucket while taking backup.

autoDelete.title:
auto-delete - this option is to indicate, whether the backup
should be deleted after the retention of the backup object is expired

time.description:
Time, when the policy should be triggered. Expected format is
time.Kitchen eg 12:04PM or 12:04pm.

retain.description: Number of objects to retain for daily policy, default value is 10.

incrementalCount.description:
Number of incremental snapshots to take before taking a full
snapshot.

minutes.description: Interval in minutes at which an action should be triggered.

retain.description: Number of objects to retain for interval policy, default value is 10.

incrementalCount.description:
Number of incremental snapshots to take before taking a full
snapshot.

date.description:
Date of the month when the policy should be triggered. If a given
date
doesn't exist in a month it'll rollover to the next date of the
month.
For example if 31 is specified, it'll trigger on either 1st or 2nd
March
depending on if it is a leap year.

time.description:
Time, when the policy should be triggered. Expected format is
time.Kitchen eg 12:04PM or 12:04pm.

retain.description: Number of objects to retain for monthly policy, default value is 10.

incrementalCount.description:
Number of incremental snapshots to take before taking a full
snapshot.

day.title:
Day of the week when the policy should be triggered.
For example, sunday or sun

time.description:
Time, when the policy should be triggered. Expected format is
time.Kitchen eg 12:04PM or 12:04pm.

retain.description: Number of objects to retain for weekly policy, default value is 10.

incrementalCount.description:
Number of incremental snapshots to take before taking a full
snapshot.

users.title: userid of the user(s) to share the cluster with

groups.title: group(s) to share the cluster with

shareClusterBackups.title: share_cluster_backups share is optional, if set to true, it will additionally share existing backups

type.title: Name of the field by which sort to be performed

SortOptionSortByType.title: field by which sorting will performed

users.title: userid of the user(s) to share the cluster with

groups.title: group(s) to share the cluster with

VolumeBackupModeType.title:
- NotSupported: for non-pxd volumes
 - Full: for pxd volumes
 - Incremental: for pxd volumes

volumeTypes.title: List of volumeType to be skipped for backing up the volume data

csiDrivers.title:
List of CSI drivers that need to used to skip the backing up of volume data
This parameter is valid only when the volume type is set with csi as one of the parameter

nfsServers.title:
List of NFS servers that need to used to skip the backing up of volume data in the case of NFS volumes
This parameter is valid only when the volume type is set with nfs as one of the parameter

volumesCompletionTime.title: This will store timestamp for the completion of volumes

resourcesCompletionTime.title: This will store timestamp for the completion of resources

totalCompletionTime.title: This will store the total completion time of the entire backup/restore

bearer.description: Authentication token, prefixed by Bearer: Bearer <token>
bearer.name: Authorization
